$eref.title: JSON schema for NPM package.json files

_88bundledDependency.description: Array of package names that will be bundled when publishing the package.

_88scriptsVersionBefore.description: Run BEFORE bump the package version

___^_.description: Any property starting with _ is valid.

___preferGlobal.description: DEPRECATED: This option used to trigger an npm warning, but it will no longer warn. It is purely there for informational purposes. It is now recommended that you install any binaries as local devDependencies wherever possible.

___main.description: The main field is a module ID that is the primary entry point to your program.

___os.description: You can specify which operating systems your module will run on

___license.description: You should specify a license for your package so that people know how they are permitted to use it, and any restrictions you're placing on it.

___type.description: The type field defines how .js and extensionless files should be treated within a particular package.json file’s package scope. Supported values: "commonjs" (default) or "module".

___example.description: Put example scripts in here. Someday, it might be exposed in some clever way.

___lib.description: Tell people where the bulk of your library is. Nothing special is done with the lib folder in any way, but it's useful meta info.

___man.description: A folder that is full of man pages. Sugar to generate a 'man' array by walking the folder.

___doc.description: Put markdown files in here. Eventually, these will be displayed nicely, maybe, someday.

___bin.description: If you specify a 'bin' directory, then all the files in that folder will be used as the 'bin' hash.

___cpu.description: If your code only runs on certain cpu architectures, you can specify which ones.

___bugs.description: The url to your project's issue tracker and / or the email address to which issues should be reported. These are helpful for people who encounter issues with your package.

___email.description: The email address to which issues should be reported.

___url.description: The url to your project's issue tracker.

___private.description: If set to true, then npm will refuse to publish it.

___description.description: This helps people discover your package, as it's listed in 'npm search'.

___version.description: Version must be parseable by node-semver, which is bundled with npm as a dependency.

___keywords.description: This helps people discover your package as it's listed in 'npm search'.

___module.description: An ECMAScript module ID that is the primary entry point to your program.

___scripts.description: The 'scripts' member is an object hash of script commands that are run at various times in the lifecycle of your package. The key is the lifecycle event, and the value is the command to run at that point.

___postpack.description: Run AFTER the tarball has been generated and moved to its final destination.

___postuninstall.description: Run AFTER the package is uninstalled

___prepare.description: Run both BEFORE the package is packed and published, and on local npm install without any arguments. This is run AFTER prepublish, but BEFORE prepublishOnly

___preinstall.description: Run BEFORE the package is installed

___prepublish.description: Run BEFORE the package is published (Also run on local npm install without any arguments)

___postversion.description: Run AFTER bump the package version

___prepack.description: run BEFORE a tarball is packed (on npm pack, npm publish, and when installing git dependencies)

___prepublishOnly.description: Run BEFORE the package is prepared and packed, ONLY on npm publish

___typings.description: Note that the "typings" field is synonymous with "types", and could be used as well.

___config.description: A 'config' hash can be used to set configuration parameters used in package scripts that persist across upgrades.

___esnext.description: A module ID with untranspiled code that is the primary entry point to your program.

___maintainers.description: A list of people who maintains this package.

___contributors.description: A list of people who contributed to this package.

___types.description: Set the types property to point to your bundled declaration file

___files.description: The 'files' field is an array of files to include in your project. If you name a folder in the array, then it will also include the files inside that folder.

___workspaces.description: To configure your yarn workspaces, please note private should be set to true to use yarn workspaces

anyof.description: your workspace folders also takes a glob

___packages.description: your workspace folder's also takes a glob

___licenses.description: DEPRECATED: Instead, use SPDX expressions, like this: { "license": "ISC" } or { "license": "(MIT OR Apache-2.0)" } see: 'https://docs.npmjs.com/files/package.json#license'

___man.description: Specify either a single file or an array of filenames to put in place for the man program to find.

___repository.description: Specify the place where your code lives. This is helpful for people who want to contribute.

___homepage.description: The url to the project homepage.

_88person.description: A person who has been involved in creating or maintaining this package

_88scriptsRestart.description: Run by the 'npm restart' command. Note: 'npm restart' will run the stop and start scripts if no restart script is provided.

_88scriptsInstallAfter.description: Run AFTER the package is installed

_88scriptsPublishAfter.description: Run AFTER the package is published

_88dependency.description: Dependencies are specified with a simple hash of package name to version range. The version range is a string which has one or more space-separated descriptors. Dependencies can also be identified with a tarball or git URL.

_88scriptsUninstallBefore.description: Run BEFORE the package is uninstalled

___src.description: The source folder of an Angular library. This is the folder where a `package.json` is located and defaults to cwd.

___workingDirectory.description: Internal working directory of ng-packagr where intermediate build files are stored (default: `.ng_pkg_build`).

___lib.description: Description of the library that is being built.

___jsx.description: A property to indicate whether your library is going to be bundling jsx/tsx files. This passes through to tsconfig - see https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/jsx.html

___externals.description: A symbol map of external dependencies. The purpose of this map is to correctly bundle a flat module file (with `rollup`). By default, `rxjs` and `@angular/*` dependency symbols are supported.

___flatModuleFile.description: Filename of the auto-generated flat module file (if empty, defaults to the package name as given in `package.json`).

___entryFile.description: Entry file to the public API of the library (default: `src/public_api.ts`).

___dest.description: The destination folder to output build artifacts and distributables of an Angular library (default: `dist`).
